data.title: bd-2f13: fix hooks audit to recognize array commands
data.description: Fixes hooks audit to recognize both array and string command formats in settings.json. Also makes sync_hooks dynamically write all eligible hooks from registry instead of hard-coded subset.

data.reason: Security review: no vulnerabilities found. Hook names from static registry, project_root from canonicalize(), validate_name() prevents injection. Array index access guarded by len() check. Cross-format retain gap is functional only, not security.

Security review: No vulnerabilities. Hook names sourced from static HookRegistry (not user input). Array indexing guarded by len() >= 4 check. Path canonicalization via canonicalize(). validate_name() prevents injection in project/channel/reviewer names. Cross-format retain gap (string vs array detection in sync_hooks) is functional-only, not security.

Security review: No vulnerabilities found. Array command detection is safe (guarded by len>=4, input from local settings.json). Dynamic hook generation from static registry is safe. validate_name() properly blocks injection. Cross-format retain filter gap is functional only, not exploitable.

No security concerns. Audit changes are read-only detection logic â€” no command execution. sync_hooks builds commands from static HookRegistry names (compile-time constants) and canonicalized paths, inserted as JSON array elements (not shell-interpolated). validate_name() prevents injection in user-supplied names. The cross-format retain filter gap (LOW from botbox-dev) is functional, not security-relevant.
